title: Vanishing Point (1971) (Uncut Version) -- High Quality
description:
This is it folks...

This is the original, 1971, uncut version of Vanishing Point!



(The movie hardly needs any explanation...)



The quality is VERY high. Same resolution as the DVD.


---------------------------------------------------------------------


Source:                      : Official DVD (R1 NTSC)


Video:

Codec / Encoder              : H.264 / x264
Resolution                   : 720 x 480 pixels
Display AR                   : 16:9
Passes:                      : 2
Bit rate                     : ~1720 Kbps
Frame rate                   : 23.976 fps
Interlacement                : Progressive


Audio:

Codec / Encoder              : AAC / NeroAAC
Bit rate mode                : VBR
Bit rate                     : ~250 Kbps
Channels                     : 2 (1)
Sampling rate                : 48 KHz


-----------------------------------------------------



For those interested, here's the x264 command line used: 

program --pass 2 --bitrate 1720 --stats ".stats" --keyint 240 --min-keyint 24 --ref 16 --mixed-refs --no-fast-pskip --bframes 16 --b-adapt 2 --b-pyramid --weightb --direct auto --subme 9 --trellis 1 --partitions all  --8x8dct --ratetol 100 --qcomp 1.0 --me umh --thread-input --progress --no-dct-decimate --no-psnr --no-ssim --output "output" "input" --sar 32:27


-----------------------------------------------------



Here's some sample screenshots:


#1: http://img28.picoodle.com/img/img28/3/10/17/f_vanishingpom_6a26835.jpg
#2: http://img02.picoodle.com/img/img02/3/10/17/f_vanishingpom_24d01a1.jpg
#3: http://img02.picoodle.com/img/img02/3/10/17/f_vanishingpom_872637b.jpg
#4: http://img02.picoodle.com/img/img02/3/10/17/f_vanishingpom_297fcc7.jpg
#5: http://img33.picoodle.com/img/img33/3/10/17/f_vanishingpom_7217cc9.jpg
#6: http://img37.picoodle.com/img/img37/3/10/17/f_vanishingpom_c382138.jpg
#7: http://img01.picoodle.com/img/img01/3/10/17/f_vanishingpom_9de37bf.jpg


-----------------------------------------------------


By the way... if you think of this film as merely a "road movie", then you're thinking in a very superficial way... Vanishing Point is NOT what you could or 
should call a road movie. It's closer to a Western. But I'd prefer not to put it 
in any specific genre, since the film's pretty unique and stands on it's own.
